title: Lists: update book status
description: Add CLI support to update a book's reading status (e.g., mark as read) and implement the Hardcover mutation.
acceptance_criteria:
- CLI accepts a status update by book ID (and optional list filter)
- Uses Hardcover mutation to update user_book status
- Handles invalid status values with a clear error
- Works with --json output

title: Lists: tests/docs for remove
description: Add test coverage and documentation for list removal.
acceptance_criteria:
- Tests cover remove success and not-found paths
- README/docs include remove usage examples
- CLI help text reflects new remove capability

title: Implement status strings
description: Reimplement `cover list --status ` so that  is read/toread/reading instead of the bare enum values. Update tests and help.

title: Add test for cover list non-status lists
description: Add coverage for list names like "Owned" or "Bad Smart People" (non-status lists) to ensure list command works.

title: Search: no-results output is not JSON
description: When search returns no results and --json is used, output is a plain string instead of a JSON object.
acceptance_criteria:
- With --json and no results, output is a valid JSON object (e.g., {"results":[]})
- Non-JSON output remains human-friendly
- Tests cover no-result JSON output

title: Interactive search
description: When using `cover search`, show the top ten results in the appropriate component from the charmbracelet/bubbles component library for bubbletea.

title: Search: tests/docs for author/series types
description: Add coverage for new search types and document the CLI options.
acceptance_criteria:
- Tests cover author/series queries (mocked)
- README/docs mention --type flag with examples
- Search help text reflects supported types

title: Introduce bubbletea
description: Add charmbracelet/bubbletea as the tui dependency for the new primary interaction mode. JSON will only be outputted from commands with the --json option.
close_reason: Added Bubbletea TUI entrypoint and shifted JSON output to --json flag

title: Search: add author/series search types
description: Extend search command to support non-title queries (author and series at minimum). Add flags for search type and map to Hardcover queries.
acceptance_criteria:
- cover search supports --type author and --type series
- Uses correct Hardcover query per type
- Results render in existing output formats (table/json/text)
- Errors when unsupported type is provided

title: Improve TUI styling with lipgloss
description: Add the charmbracelet/lipgloss package to the project and use its methods to improve the presentation of the command in its interactive mode

title: Search: -i still returns full JSON
description: The search -i/--isbn flag should return only ISBN(s) but currently outputs full JSON.
acceptance_criteria:
- When --isbn is set, output is only ISBN(s) (text or JSON)
- Handles no-ISBN case with clear message
- Tests cover ISBN-only output

title: Support cover list for non-status lists
description: Allow cover list to fetch lists like "Owned" or "Bad Smart People" that are not status-based.

title: Lists: tests/docs for status updates
description: Add coverage and documentation for updating book status.
acceptance_criteria:
- Tests cover status update success and validation errors
- README/docs include status update examples
- CLI help text reflects status update capability

title: Search: returns only first result despite --per-page
description: Search command appears to only display the first result even when --per-page is greater than 1. Current behavior selects first hit and prints single item.
acceptance_criteria:
- When --per-page > 1 and multiple results returned, CLI can display all results in table/json modes
- JSON output includes an array of results when multiple are requested
- Tests cover multi-result output

title: Lists: remove books from reading lists
description: Implement CLI support to remove a book from a list and add Hardcover API mutation for deletion.
acceptance_criteria:
- New command or flag removes a book by ID or search match
- Uses Hardcover mutation to delete user_book/list entry
- Success and not-found cases are handled with clear messages
- Works with --json output
